page.title: 07FARMING AROUND ST.AGNES
page.content: MANY FARMS IN THE AREA ARE OWNED BY OLD PEOPLE AND HAVE BEEN PASSED FROM GENERATION TO GENERATION.MOST OF THE FARMS IN THE AREA OWNED SEVERAL DOZEN ACRES BUT MANY OF THEM HAVE NOW BEEN SOLD TO PRIVATE OWNERS AND ARE USED AS SMALL HOLDINGS FOR GRAZING HORSES.MANY OF THE FARMS IN OUR AREA CULTIVATE GRASS FOR HAY AND SILAGE BUT SOME PEOPLE USE THEIR FIELDS FOR GRAZING CATTLE. THE MAIN LIVESTOCK IN THE FIELDS WERE HORSES, COWS AND A FEW SHEEP. MOST OF THE PLACES THAT WE VISITED WERE OLD AND SOME WERE EVEN IN RUINS.
